thread.title: Is this how Danny Dyer gets written out of EastEnders? Mick Carter prepares to be sent to prison
thread.title_full: Is this how Danny Dyer gets written out of EastEnders? Mick Carter prepares to be sent to prison

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Is this how Danny Dyer gets written out of EastEnders? Mick Carter prepares to be sent to prison
text:
Is this how Danny Dyer gets written out of EastEnders? Mick Carter prepares to be sent to prison Writer's have been forced to alter scripts following the actor's temporary departure Share Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing!   
Danny Dyer is currently in South Africa as he takes a short break from playing loveable landlord Mick Carter in EastEnders due to exhaustion. 
Danny's brief departure has meant writers have been forced to alter scripts while he's away. 
And now it looks like Mick will be sent to prison in order to explain the 39-year-old actor’s absence from the soap. 
In scenes that will air tonight (Thursday 9 March) Mick receives an unexpected offer that could keep him out of jail. (Photo: BBC) 
But he shocks the whole Carter family by refusing to take it. 
And with a prison sentence for Mick now looking likely, Johnny urges his dad to tell Linda the truth about Lee and the debts before he gets locked up. Danny Dyer and Kellie Bright as Mick and Linda Carter (Photo: BBC) 
The 39-year-old actor, who plays Mick Carter, supped a couple of beers on the long haul flight with onlookers saying he looked tired. 
He has vowed to properly rest for the sake of his family. 
A source said: “Danny knows he has to rest-up and recuperate. He has been ground down by the workload on EastEnders and then partying on top of it. 
“This trip is going to do him the world of good. He can remain anonymous there and he can properly rest." Like us on Facebook
